quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Fame and Pro Football Hall
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, athlete, college. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Henry Aaron hit home run number 715 off of which Dodger pitcher?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al Downing

questions.question: This retired cornerback, who played college football at Grambling University, was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame on July 28, 1984.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Brown

questions.question: Which three teams are eligible to win The Commanders Trophy ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Army, Navy and Air Force

questions.question: Atlanta Fulton County Stadium had what nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Launching Pad

questions.question: Which former quarterback was named the Most Valuable Player of Super Bowl XXIX, and was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2005?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Young

questions.question: Who was the first person to become a member of both the Pro Football Hall of Fame and the Baseball Hall of Fame?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cal Hubbard

questions.question: This legendary Green Bay Packers head coach, inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 1971, had the following maxim: Winning isnt everything; its the only thing.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vince Lombardi

questions.question: What year did the Braves move to Atlanta?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1966

questions.question: This former American football wide receiver, nicknamed Bambi, was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 1978.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lance Alworth

questions.question: In the 1996 World Series, this Braves player hit a home run in his first two at-bats.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andruw Jones

questions.question: Which versatile athlete, inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 1963, won Olympic gold medals in the pentathlon and decathlon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Thorpe

questions.question: Which former football quarterback, inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 1977, was the MVP of the first two Super Bowls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bart Starr

questions.question: This pitcher ended Pete Roses 44 game hit streak in 1978 with a strikeout.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gene Garber

questions.question: What is Chipper Jones actual first name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Larry

questions.question: The first couple of years in Atlanta, the Braves were considered lovable losers.  They won the first NL West title in 1969, the first year of divisional play.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Michael Jordan and Boxing
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, title, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: After retiring from basketball in 1993, Michael Jordan spent the next year playing professional baseball.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which boxing heavyweight champ was the subject of the movie The Great White Hope?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Johnson

questions.question: Michael Jordan majored in geography at what university?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: University of North Carolina

questions.question: How did boxer James J. Braddock get most of his money?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: From Joe Louis

questions.question: Which boxers shared the boxing heavyweight crown in 1978 ?

options.text: Ali, Norton, Spinks, Holmes and Ali

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ali, Norton, Spinks, Holmes and Ali

questions.question: What country did boxing champion Lennox Lewis represent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: England

questions.question: Who did Muhammad Ali beat to get the boxing crown the second time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Foreman

questions.question: Who is considered the first modern heavyweight boxing champion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John L. Sullivan

questions.question: Who was the winning pitcher in game six of the 1995 World Series, 1-0 victory over the Cleveland Indians?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Glavine

questions.question: Former NBA player, Michael Jeffrey Jordan was born on February 17, what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1963

questions.question: What is the height of former NBA player, Michael Jordan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6 6

questions.question: A Swedish boxer once held the boxing heavyweight title.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who lost the boxing heavyweight championship to Joe Louis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James J. Braddock

questions.question: Who was the only undefeated boxing heavyweight champ, later killed in an airplane accident?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rocky Marciano

questions.question: From whom did Muhammad Ali get the championship the first time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sonny Liston

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: New York Mets and Player
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, instructor, roving. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What Dominican Republic born baseball player, played shortstop for the New York Mets in 1979?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank Taveras

questions.question: What former catcher managed the New York Mets in 1973?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yogi Berra

questions.question: This baseball player, signed by the New York Yankees as an amateur free agent in 1976, played for the New York Mets during 1984-1987.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rafael Santana

questions.question: What number did Michael Jordan wear after the return to NBA from his first retirement?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 45

questions.question: This right-handed Major League Baseball player won the World Series MVP award, and then became the first player to sign with new team after winning the award, joining the Orioles in 1987.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ray Knight

questions.question: Joining the team in 1962, this former infielder, manager and coach was the first 3rd baseman to play for the New York Mets.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don Zimmer

questions.question: This former pitcher, manager and executive in Major League Baseball, who led the Philadelphia Phillies to their first World Series title in 1980, managed the New York Mets during 1993-96.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dallas Green

questions.question: Which multiple MVP winner was called the Georgia Peach?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ty Cobb

questions.question: This great pitcher of the New York Mets won the Rookie of the Year award in 1972 by going 15-10 with a 2.32 ERA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jon Matlack

questions.question: This baseball player and American national icon was known as The Sultan of Swat.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Babe Ruth

questions.question: Who became owner of  Major League Baseball, New york Mets in 1961?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joan Payson

questions.question: After five seasons as a roving instructor for the Seattle Mariners, this man eventually got hired by the New York Mets as the pitching coach, a position he held for ten years.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mel Stottlemyre

questions.question: On January 19, 2000, Jordan returned to the NBA not as a player, but as part owner and President of Basketball Operations of which team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Washington Wizards

questions.question: What former Major League Baseball shortstop, who at the time played for the New York Mets, got into a fight with Pete Rose during the 1973 playoffs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bud Harrelson

questions.question: Former NBA player Michael Jordan won his second Olympic gold medal in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1992

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Player and Baseball Player
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, summer, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This person, widely regarded as the founder of the modern Olympic Games, presented his ideas of reviving the Olympics at a 1894 congress, held in Paris.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pierre de Coubertin

questions.question: This Baseball Hall of Famer is known as The Splendid Splinter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ted Williams

questions.question: During these Summer Olympics, 11 members of the Israeli team were taken hostage and later killed by Palestinian terrorists.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Munich 1972

questions.question: Which Hall of Fame pitcher was known as Rapid Robert?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Feller

questions.question: Which New York Yankee pitcher was known as Louisiana Lightning?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ron Guidry

questions.question: This former baseball player, called The Ol Perfesser, left his mark on the game as a manager.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Casey Stengel

questions.question: Dating back to 776 B.C., the ancient Olympic Games were held in the valley of Olympia in southwestern Greece, to honor this god.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zeus

questions.question: Which player for the New York Mets was called Choo-Choo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clarence Coleman

questions.question: This baseball player, who started his career with the Texas Rangers in 1991 at the age of 19, is known as Pudge.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ivan Rodriguez

questions.question: This former baseball player called The Major won the World Series in his first two seasons as manager.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ralph Houk

questions.question: This baseball player, nicknamed True, was a three time 20-game winner for the Oakland As.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vida Blue

questions.question: This baseball player appeared in 14 World Series, won the American League MVP Award three times and was elected to the Hall of Fame in 1972. His given name is Lawrence Peter but hes better known under what nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yogi

questions.question: The parade of the nations is part of the opening ceremony of the Olympic Games. Since the1928 Summer Olympics, which nation traditionally leads the parade?

options.text: The first country in alphabetical order
The country with the most medals from the last Olympics

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Greece

questions.question: One of the most important symbols of the Olympic Games is the flag with five interlocking rings representing the unity of the continents. The rings appear in five colours, on white background. Why were the colours red, blue, green, yellow, and black chosen for the rings?

options.text: Because each of these colours is a symbol of one of the continents
Because these are the colours of Nature
Because each country at that time had one of these colours in its national flag

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because each country at that time had one of these colours in its national flag

questions.question: This animal, possessing qualities such as resistance, strength and liveliness, was the first Olympic animal mascot, chosen for the1972 Munich Olympic games.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Waldi, the dachshund

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Wrestler and Player
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, john, committee. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The International Olympic Committee, created in June of 1894 to revive the Olympic Games, is the supreme authority of the Olympic Movement.  It is based in which city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lausanne

questions.question: Who was the second wrestler to become Mr. Money in the Bank?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: RVD

questions.question: In 1958, Ted Williams signed an extension with the Boston Red Sox to make him the highest paid player in Major League Baseball at the time. How much was it for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: $135,000

questions.question: This Major League baseball player, who spent his career with the Chicago Cubs and St. Louis Cardinals, was elected to the Baseball Hall of Fame in 1985.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lou Brock

questions.question: The first official Winter Olympic games, initially called ‘The International Winter Sports Week, were held in 1924 in this Alpine town.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chamonix

questions.question: Professional wrestler JBL wrote a book titled Get More Cash Instantly.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: American professional wrestler John Cena was born in Tampa, Florida in 1975.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The real name of Canadian professional wrestler Trish Stratus is Patricia Sue Stratus.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This person, president of the International Olympic Committee from 1980 to 2001, was criticised for widespread corruption in IOC members during his term, as well as for his ties with the former fascist government in his country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Juan Antonio Samaranch

questions.question: Who was the wrestler that knocked Lilian Garcia off the ring apron during the 5th edition of RAW?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlie Haas

questions.question: This advertising slogan of Nike triggered harsh criticism during the 1996 Olympic Games in Atlanta, because it was in contradiction with the Olympic principles.

options.text: ‘Nobody is perfect. My name is nobody’.
‘You don’t win silver – you lose gold’.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ‘You don’t win silver – you lose gold’.

questions.question: This former Major League Baseball center fielder was the first player ever taken in an amateur draft by the Seattle Pilots.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gorman Thomas

questions.question: Which member of the McMahon family tried to drug Triple H backstage in one of the editions of  Raw?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shane McMahon

questions.question: Amy  Dumas, an American professional wrestler, goes by what ring name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lita

questions.question: This baseball star of the 1950s was the second black player to be signed by a Major League team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Larry Doby

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Career and Team
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, cubs, heisman. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This quarterback won the 1966 Heisman Trophy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Spurrier

questions.question: Who of the following never played quarterback for Alabama Crimson Tide?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Archie Manning

questions.question: Which team did Babe Ruth start his career with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Sox

questions.question: Frank Robinson had a long and successful playing career. Which team did Frank debut with on April 17, 1956?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reds

questions.question: Barry Bonds hit the headlines since he became a rookie for which of these teams?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pirates

questions.question: This baseball star won his only MVP award in 1923.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Babe Ruth

questions.question: While Sammy Sosa gained most of his fame with the Cubs, which team did he debut for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rangers

questions.question: Five players were elected to the Baseball Hall of Fame in the first balloting in 1936. The first four were Ty Cobb, Babe Ruth, Honus Wagner, Christy Mathewson. Who was the fifth inductee?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walter Johnson

questions.question: Which of these teams did Alex Rodriguez start his career with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mariners

questions.question: Reggie Jackson was inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame in 1993. Which team did he start his career with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Athletics

questions.question: Ken Griffey Jr. has played with the Reds but which other team did he start his career with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mariners

questions.question: Dale Murphy played his last game on May 21, 1993 for the Colorado Rockies and he started his career with which of these teams?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Braves

questions.question: Ernie Banks, known as Mr. Cub, started his career with which team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cubs

questions.question: On September 11, 1985, Pete Rose hit a home run to break Ty Cobbs career hits record of 4,192 hits.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Jeff Bagwell was drafted by the Red Sox but started his career with which team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Astros
